text: Nickel(II) carbonate, also known as nickelous carbonate, is a chemical compound. Its chemical formula is NiCO3. It contains nickel in its +2 oxidation state. It also contains carbonate ions. ==Properties== Nickel(II) carbonate is a pale green solid. It does not dissolve in water. It reacts with acids to make carbon dioxide. It turns into carbon dioxide and nickel(II) oxide when heated. ==Preparation== It is made by reacting sodium carbonate with nickel(II) chloride or nickel(II) sulfate. ==Uses== It is used in pigments and catalysts that have nickel in them. ==Related pages== *Nickel(II) hydroxide *Nickel(II) nitrate Category:Nickel compounds Category:Carbonates
